title: Supabase project and database setup
description: As a developer, I want a Supabase project provisioned with PostgreSQL so that the app has a database and auth backend ready.
acceptance_criteria: Supabase project is created with PostgreSQL database accessible via connection string
Supabase Auth is enabled with email/password sign-up
Environment variables (SUPABASE_URL, SUPABASE_ANON_KEY, SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY, DATABASE_URL) are documented in .env.example

title: Alembic migration for accounts table
description: As a developer, I want an Alembic migration that creates the `accounts` table so that users can store brokerage account metadata.
acceptance_criteria: Migration creates `accounts` table with columns: id (uuid PK), user_id (uuid FK → auth.users.id NOT NULL), name (text NOT NULL), broker (text NOT NULL), tax_treatment (text nullable), created_at (timestamptz), updated_at (timestamptz)
Running `alembic upgrade head` applies cleanly on a fresh database
Running `alembic downgrade -1` drops the table

title: Alembic migration for positions table
description: As a developer, I want an Alembic migration that creates the `positions` table with all required columns and indexes.
acceptance_criteria: Migration creates `positions` table with all columns from the spec: id, user_id, account_id (FK → accounts.id), ticker, type (CHECK: COVERED_CALL, CASH_SECURED_PUT), status (CHECK: OPEN, CLOSED, default OPEN), open_date, expiration_date, close_date, strike_price (numeric), contracts (int), multiplier (int default 100), premium_per_share (numeric), open_fees (numeric default 0), close_fees (numeric default 0), close_price_per_share (numeric nullable), outcome (CHECK: EXPIRED, ASSIGNED, CLOSED_EARLY, ROLLED), roll_group_id (uuid nullable), notes (text nullable), tags (text[] nullable), created_at, updated_at
Indexes exist on (user_id, status), (user_id, ticker), (user_id, expiration_date)
Migration applies and rolls back cleanly

title: SQLAlchemy models for accounts and positions
description: As a developer, I want SQLAlchemy 2.0 ORM models for `accounts` and `positions` so that the API layer can query and mutate data.
acceptance_criteria: Account model maps all columns from the accounts table
Position model maps all columns from the positions table including the text[] tags field
Relationships are defined: Account.positions (one-to-many), Position.account (many-to-one)
Models use mapped_column() style (SQLAlchemy 2.0 declarative)

title: FastAPI auth middleware (Supabase JWT verification)
description: As a developer, I want middleware that verifies Supabase JWTs on every request (except /health) so that all API endpoints are protected.
acceptance_criteria: Requests without Authorization header receive 401
Requests with invalid/expired JWT receive 401
Valid JWT extracts user_id and makes it available via a dependency (e.g., get_current_user)
GET /health is excluded from auth checks
JWT verification uses Supabase JWKS or shared secret

title: Pydantic schemas for accounts and positions
description: As a developer, I want Pydantic v2 request/response schemas so that API inputs are validated and outputs are serialized consistently.
acceptance_criteria: AccountCreate, AccountUpdate, AccountResponse schemas exist
PositionCreate, PositionUpdate, PositionResponse schemas exist
PositionResponse includes computed fields: premium_total, premium_net, collateral, roc_period, dte, annualized_roc
Enums or Literal types enforce valid values for type, status, outcome, broker
All schemas use Pydantic v2 model_config

title: Accounts CRUD endpoints
description: As a user, I want to create, list, and update my brokerage accounts so that I can organize positions by account.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/accounts returns only the authenticated user's accounts
POST /api/v1/accounts creates an account with name, broker, and optional tax_treatment; returns the created account
PATCH /api/v1/accounts/{id} updates name, broker, or tax_treatment; returns 404 if account doesn't exist or belongs to another user
All responses use AccountResponse schema

title: Create position endpoint
description: As a user, I want to create a new option position so that I can track a trade I've opened.
acceptance_criteria: POST /api/v1/positions creates a position with all required fields (ticker, type, account_id, open_date, expiration_date, strike_price, contracts, premium_per_share)
ticker is uppercased before storage
account_id must belong to the authenticated user; returns 400 otherwise
Response includes computed fields (premium_total, collateral, roc_period, dte, annualized_roc)
Optional fields: multiplier, open_fees, notes, tags

title: List positions endpoint with filtering and sorting
description: As a user, I want to list my positions with filters (status, ticker, type, account, expiration range) and sorting so I can find specific trades.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/positions returns only the authenticated user's positions
Supports query params: status, ticker, type, account_id, expiration_start, expiration_end, sort, order (asc/desc)
Default sort is by open_date descending
Each position in the response includes computed fields
Returns empty list (not error) when no positions match

title: Update position endpoint
description: As a user, I want to update fields on an existing position so that I can correct data entry mistakes.
acceptance_criteria: PATCH /api/v1/positions/{id} updates any subset of editable fields
Returns 404 if position doesn't exist or belongs to another user
Cannot change user_id
updated_at timestamp is refreshed on every update
Response includes recalculated computed fields

title: Close position endpoint
description: As a user, I want to close an open position by setting the outcome, close date, and optional close price so that the position moves to history.
acceptance_criteria: POST /api/v1/positions/{id}/close accepts: outcome (EXPIRED, ASSIGNED, CLOSED_EARLY), close_date, close_price_per_share (optional), close_fees (optional)
Sets status to CLOSED
Returns 400 if position is already closed
Returns 404 if position doesn't exist or belongs to another user
Response includes updated computed fields including premium_net with close_fees

title: Roll position endpoint
description: As a user, I want to roll a position (close existing + open new linked position) in a single API call so that rolled trades are tracked together.
acceptance_criteria: POST /api/v1/positions/{id}/roll accepts close fields for the old position and open fields for the new position
Old position is closed with outcome = ROLLED
New position is created with a shared roll_group_id (generated UUID)
Old position also gets the same roll_group_id
Both operations happen atomically (single DB transaction)
Returns both the closed and new position in the response

title: Dashboard summary endpoint
description: As a user, I want a summary of my trading metrics (total premium, open count, upcoming expirations) so I can see portfolio-level stats.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/dashboard/summary returns: total_premium_collected, premium_mtd, open_position_count, upcoming_expirations (positions expiring within 7 days)
Supports optional start/end date query params to scope the date range
Calculations use premium_net (premium_total - open_fees - close_fees) for closed positions and premium_total for open
Returns zeroes (not errors) when no data exists

title: Dashboard by-ticker endpoint
description: As a user, I want per-ticker stats (premium, trade count, average annualized ROC) so I can see which tickers are most profitable.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/dashboard/by-ticker returns an array of objects: { ticker, total_premium, trade_count, avg_annualized_roc }
Supports optional start/end date query params
Results are sorted by total_premium descending by default
Only includes tickers with at least one position in the date range

title: Frontend: Install and configure Tailwind CSS + shadcn/ui
description: As a developer, I want Tailwind CSS and shadcn/ui installed and configured in the Vite + React project so that all UI components use a consistent design system.
acceptance_criteria: Tailwind CSS is installed and configured with the project's content paths
shadcn/ui is initialized (components.json exists, cn utility is available)
A test component (e.g., Button) renders correctly with Tailwind styles
Dark mode is not required (light mode only)

title: Frontend: Install and configure TanStack Table + TanStack Query
description: As a developer, I want TanStack Table and TanStack Query set up so that the app can render data tables and manage server state.
acceptance_criteria: TanStack Table (@tanstack/react-table) is installed
TanStack Query (@tanstack/react-query) is installed with a QueryClientProvider wrapping the app
A basic query hook (e.g., usePositions) can fetch from the API and return typed data
React Query Devtools are available in development

title: Frontend: Routing and layout shell
description: As a user, I want a navigation layout with routes for Open Positions, History, Dashboard, and Settings so I can move between pages.
acceptance_criteria: React Router (or equivalent) is configured with routes: / (Open Positions), /history, /dashboard, /settings
A persistent sidebar or top nav shows links to all pages with active state highlighting
A layout shell wraps all authenticated pages with the nav and a content area
Unauthenticated users are redirected to /login

title: Frontend: Supabase Auth client setup
description: As a developer, I want the Supabase JS client initialized in the frontend so that auth operations (sign in, sign out, token refresh) work.
acceptance_criteria: Supabase JS client is initialized with SUPABASE_URL and SUPABASE_ANON_KEY from env vars
An AuthProvider context exposes: user, session, signIn, signOut, loading state
Access token is automatically attached to API requests via an Axios/fetch interceptor
Token refresh is handled automatically by the Supabase client

title: Frontend: Login page
description: As a user, I want a login page where I can sign in with email and password so that I can access my data.
acceptance_criteria: Login page has email and password fields with a Sign In button
Successful login redirects to / (Open Positions)
Failed login shows an error message (invalid credentials, network error)
Page is accessible at /login and is the default for unauthenticated users

title: Frontend: API client with auth interceptor
description: As a developer, I want a configured API client (Axios or fetch wrapper) that automatically includes the Supabase JWT in requests to the FastAPI backend.
acceptance_criteria: API client has a base URL pointing to the FastAPI backend
Every request includes Authorization: Bearer <token> header using the current Supabase session token
401 responses trigger a token refresh attempt; if refresh fails, user is redirected to /login
Typed API functions exist for each endpoint (e.g., getPositions, createPosition, closePosition)

title: Frontend: Account management UI
description: As a user, I want to view, add, and edit my brokerage accounts so I can associate positions with the correct account.
acceptance_criteria: Settings page (or a dedicated section) lists all accounts with name, broker, and tax treatment
An Add Account form/modal allows creating a new account with name, broker (dropdown: robinhood, merrill, other), and optional tax treatment
Inline edit or edit modal allows updating account fields
Account list refreshes after add/edit operations

title: Frontend: Open Positions table
description: As a user, I want to see a table of all my open positions with key columns so I can monitor my active trades.
acceptance_criteria: Table displays open positions with columns: ticker, type, account, strike, contracts, premium/share, premium total, collateral, open date, expiration, DTE, annualized ROC
Table uses TanStack Table with sorting on all columns
Table has a sticky header that remains visible on scroll
Empty state shows a message prompting the user to add their first position
Data is fetched via TanStack Query with loading and error states

title: Frontend: Add Position modal
description: As a user, I want a modal form to add a new option position so I can track a trade I've just opened.
acceptance_criteria: Modal has fields: account (dropdown), ticker (text, auto-uppercased), type (COVERED_CALL / CASH_SECURED_PUT), open date, expiration date, strike price, contracts, premium per share
Optional fields: multiplier (default 100), open fees, notes, tags
Form validates required fields and shows inline errors
On submit, calls POST /api/v1/positions and closes the modal on success
Positions table refreshes after successful creation

title: Frontend: Close Position modal
description: As a user, I want a modal to close an open position by selecting the outcome so the position moves to history.
acceptance_criteria: Modal is triggered from a row action (button or context menu) on the Open Positions table
Fields: outcome (EXPIRED, ASSIGNED, CLOSED_EARLY), close date (default today), close price per share (optional), close fees (optional)
On submit, calls POST /api/v1/positions/{id}/close
Positions table refreshes after successful close (position disappears from open list)
Error states are displayed (e.g., trying to close already-closed position)

title: Frontend: Roll Position modal (two-step)
description: As a user, I want a two-step modal to roll a position: step 1 closes the old position, step 2 opens a new one prefilled with the old position's data.
acceptance_criteria: Step 1: Close form (same fields as Close Position modal) with outcome pre-set to ROLLED
Step 2: Open form (same fields as Add Position modal) prefilled with the old position's ticker, type, account, and contracts
User can modify any prefilled fields before submitting
On submit, calls POST /api/v1/positions/{id}/roll with both close and open payloads
Success shows confirmation and refreshes the positions table

title: Frontend: History page (closed positions table)
description: As a user, I want a History page showing all closed positions so I can review past trades.
acceptance_criteria: Table displays closed positions with columns: ticker, type, account, strike, contracts, premium total, premium net, open date, close date, outcome, annualized ROC
Supports filters: ticker search, type, account, outcome, date range
Sorting works on all columns
Rolled positions show a visual indicator linking them to their roll group
Data fetched via TanStack Query with status=CLOSED filter

title: Frontend: Dashboard summary widgets
description: As a user, I want a dashboard page showing high-level metrics (total premium, open count, upcoming expirations) so I can assess my portfolio at a glance.
acceptance_criteria: Dashboard page displays cards/widgets: Total Premium Collected, Premium MTD, Open Position Count, Upcoming Expirations (next 7 days)
Each widget shows the value prominently with appropriate formatting (currency for premiums, count for others)
Data is fetched from GET /api/v1/dashboard/summary
Loading skeletons display while data is being fetched
Date range filter allows scoping the summary to a custom period

title: Frontend: Ticker summary table on dashboard
description: As a user, I want a per-ticker breakdown on the dashboard showing premium and ROC stats so I can see which underlyings are most profitable.
acceptance_criteria: Table or card grid shows each ticker with: total premium, trade count, average annualized ROC
Sorted by total premium descending by default
Data is fetched from GET /api/v1/dashboard/by-ticker
Respects the same date range filter as the summary widgets
Empty state shows a message when no closed positions exist

title: Backend: Yahoo Finance price proxy endpoint
description: As a user, I want the backend to fetch current stock prices so that the frontend can display live prices without exposing API keys.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/prices?tickers=AAPL,TSLA returns current price and change % for each ticker
Responses are cached for 60 seconds to avoid rate limiting
Invalid tickers return null values (not errors) in the response
Endpoint requires authentication
Response includes a timestamp for when the price was last fetched

title: Frontend: Live price column and polling
description: As a user, I want to see current stock prices in the Open Positions table, refreshed every 60 seconds, so I can monitor positions relative to market prices.
acceptance_criteria: Open Positions table has a 'Current Price' column showing the live price and change %
On page load, distinct tickers from open positions are collected and fetched via GET /api/v1/prices
Prices auto-refresh every 60 seconds via TanStack Query polling (refetchInterval)
A stale indicator appears if the last price update is > 5 minutes old
Price near strike highlights: CC where price >= strike * 0.95; CSP where price <= strike * 1.05 (thresholds from settings)

title: Frontend: Client-side alerts and alert banner
description: As a user, I want in-app alerts for expiring positions and prices near strike so I can take action before it's too late.
acceptance_criteria: Alert banner appears at the top of the page when alerts are active
Expiration alert: triggers when a position expires within N days (default 7, configurable in settings)
Price near strike alert: triggers for CC when price >= strike * (1 - threshold) and CSP when price <= strike * (1 + threshold)
Stale price alert: triggers when price data is older than 5 minutes
Alerts are dismissible but reappear on next price refresh if conditions still met
Alert evaluation runs on every price refresh cycle

title: Backend: CSV export endpoint
description: As a user, I want to export my positions as a CSV file so I can analyze data in Excel or Google Sheets.
acceptance_criteria: GET /api/v1/export/positions.csv returns a downloadable CSV file
Supports query params: start, end, status, ticker to filter exported data
CSV includes all position fields plus computed fields (premium_total, premium_net, collateral, roc_period, dte, annualized_roc)
Content-Disposition header triggers a file download in the browser
Empty result set returns a CSV with headers only

title: Frontend: CSV export button
description: As a user, I want an Export to CSV button that downloads my positions with current filters applied.
acceptance_criteria: Export button is visible on both Open Positions and History pages
Clicking the button triggers a download of GET /api/v1/export/positions.csv with the current page's filters as query params
Button shows a loading state while the download is in progress
Downloaded file has a descriptive filename (e.g., positions_2024-01-15.csv)

title: Frontend: Settings page (alert thresholds and preferences)
description: As a user, I want a Settings page where I can configure alert thresholds and display preferences.
acceptance_criteria: Settings page is accessible at /settings
Configurable fields: expiration warning days (default 7), price near strike threshold (default 0.05 = 5%), stale price minutes (default 5)
Settings are persisted in localStorage (no backend storage needed for 1-2 users)
Changes take effect immediately on the Open Positions page without a page reload
Settings page also includes the account management section (US-021)

title: Frontend: Column visibility toggles and UX polish
description: As a user, I want to show/hide columns in the positions table and have a polished filtering experience.
acceptance_criteria: A column visibility dropdown lets users toggle individual columns on/off
Column visibility preferences are persisted in localStorage
Filter inputs (ticker search, type, account, date range) are in a filter bar above the table
Table has responsive horizontal scrolling for many columns
All tables have consistent styling via shadcn/ui data table patterns

title: QA validation pass and testing tickets
description: Meta-ticket for creating testing and QA sub-tickets that validate all major work from US-001 through US-035. Create as many sub-tickets as needed to thoroughly test and validate all prior work against the spec.
acceptance_criteria: All backend endpoints are tested for correctness, edge cases, and auth enforcement
All frontend pages and components are tested for spec adherence, UX consistency, and error handling
Code quality audit: identify and resolve code smells, dead code, inconsistent patterns, and missing types
Product adherence: validate each prior ticket's acceptance criteria against the actual implementation (test against the spec file)
Clean code practices: ensure consistent naming, proper error handling, no hardcoded values, and DRY principles
Create as many sub-tickets as deemed necessary to cover all areas thoroughly
